alert.note: Alert for Clearwater (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:42PM CDT until June 24 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...NORTHWESTERN OTTER TAIL...NORTHERN WILKIN... SOUTHERN MAHNOMEN...BECKER...SOUTH CENTRAL CLEARWATER AND NORTHERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 942 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from White Earth Nation to near Cormorant to near Barrie, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Tulaby Lake, Cormorant, Rollag, Dunvilla, Many Point Lake, Pelican Rapids, Colfax, Bad Medicine Lake, Lake Lida, Galchutt, Pine Point and Ponsford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 23 and 48. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 13 and 43. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
